races.race_name: Star Sports Brighton Owners Series Apprentice Classified Stakes

runners.comment: Found the drop to 6f against him here a month ago and is one to consider
runners.spotlight: Always been well suited by switchback tracks and went close over C&D last autumn; found the drop to 6f against him here a month ago and is one to consider.

runners.comment: Dual course winner from the front, latterly over 1m2f last August; 7f a bare minimum
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner from the front, latterly over 1m2f last August; back in form on his return to turf three weeks ago (1m) but he may not be able to dictate today and at least another furlong would have been optimal under these conditions.

runners.comment: Consistent but expensive to follow; needs to improve on three previous turf efforts
runners.spotlight: Consistent but expensive to follow since two wins late last year; this easier, now eligible for 0-50 company once more, but he'll need to improve on three previous turf efforts back from six weeks off.

runners.comment: Offered little back from a few months off recently and others have more pressing claims
runners.spotlight: Last season's two victories came over 1m but he's still effective over this trip (previous C&D winner); offered little back from a few months off recently, though, and others have more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Three-time course winner who hasn't had much luck here the past twice; leading claims
runners.spotlight: Three-time course winner who hasn't had much luck here the past twice, hitting traffic over 6f before being unsuited by the way the race panned out latest; Ryan Kavanagh has plenty of experience for 5lb in this company and she's shortlisted.

runners.comment: Often races keenly and the drop to 7f shouldn't hurt but some rain would have been ideal
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who finished a clear second, behind an improver, on his return to turf last week; often races keenly and the drop to 7f shouldn't hurt but he's tended to steer clear of fast turf in the past and some rain would have been ideal.

runners.comment: Often runs well without winning but the fact he's only won one of his last 46 says it all
runners.spotlight: Run well here numerous times without winning and his yard is in better form now than when he was below market expectations in April; the fact he's only won one of his last 46 says it all though.

runners.comment: Regressive mare; hasn't seen it out in a couple of previous tries at beyond sprint trips
runners.spotlight: Regressive mare who hasn't seen it out in a couple of previous tries at beyond sprint distances; the lowest rated of these and would be a surprise winner.

runners.comment: Struggled badly in three runs for this yard, having been picked up for just 1,000gns
runners.spotlight: Plenty of chances for Eve Johnson Houghton in sprints last year and has struggled badly in three runs for this yard, having been picked up for just 1,000gns; this is easier but he can't be recommended.

races.race_name: Weatherbys Racing Bank Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Has the edge in experience; remains to be seen if the drop to easy 5f works in his favour
runners.spotlight: Well supported when a clear second on his Polytrack comeback in April and backed that up back on turf three weeks ago (both 6f); edge in experience but it remains to be seen whether the drop to an easy 5f works in his favour.

runners.comment: Much better down to 5f a fortnight ago; about sets the standard on today's turf debut
runners.spotlight: Pulled hard from a wide stall when well held on his 6f debut but fared much better down to 5f at Wolverhampton a fortnight ago; about sets the standard on today's turf debut.

runners.comment: 100-1 when finishing a remote last on 6f soft-ground debut for Sylvester Kirk last autumn
runners.spotlight: 100-1 when finishing a remote last on his 6f soft-ground debut for Sylvester Kirk last autumn; since gelded and will need to leave that well behind.

runners.comment: 95,000gns foal, 320,000gns yearling; sister to two useful sprinters; market will guide
runners.spotlight: 95,000gns foal, 320,000gns yearling who's a sister to two useful sprinters and a half-sister to another; hood on for today's debut and the market will guide.

races.race_name: Star Sports We Believe In Bookmaking Handicap

runners.comment: Hit traffic over 7f here 12 days ago and has every chance off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Inclined to hang left a couple of times since handicapping and may yet have a bit more to offer as he learns; hit traffic over 7f here 12 days ago and has every chance of ending a dry run for his yard in a weak handicap off the same mark.

runners.comment: Exposed filly who didn't look to see out a stiff 1m2f latest; some way down pecking order
runners.spotlight: Exposed filly who didn't look to see out a stiff 1m2f last time; scrambled home off this mark at Wolverhampton early in the year but is some way down the pecking order today.

runners.comment: Good support on Tapeta 11 days ago but faded quickly once headed and has it to prove
runners.spotlight: Pulled hard and hung left on his firm-ground handicap debut; came in for good support on Tapeta 11 days ago but faded quickly once headed and has it to prove after that.

runners.comment: Best runs on Tapeta; tried in a third form of headgear off the back of a poor one latest
runners.spotlight: Best efforts have come on Tapeta (poor show as favourite here last autumn) and she's tried in a third form of headgear off the back of another lacklustre turf run last Tuesday.

runners.comment: No great improvement on his handicap debut five weeks ago and needs more
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to the yard's useful Bad Company who started huge prices for his first three runs; no great improvement on his handicap debut five weeks ago, when inclined to edge left under pressure, and needs more.

runners.comment: Pulled hard and hit a bit of traffic latest; that gave something to build on back on turf
runners.spotlight: Again started a big price for her handicap debut (Tapeta) 11 days ago but not a bad effort behind a progressive winner, having pulled hard and hit a bit of traffic; that gave something to build on back on turf.

runners.comment: Exposed maiden who's only finished placed once from 12 starts; risks involved
runners.spotlight: Exposed maiden who's only finished placed once from 12 starts; has been offering more here of late, given he's blown the start, pulled hard and not seen it out over 1m2f, but there are risks involved; wears first-time cheekpieces (a visor failed to have a positive effect previously).

runners.comment: Exposed maiden who had a few chances in similar company on the AW earlier in the year
runners.spotlight: Exposed maiden who had a few chances in similar company on the AW earlier in the year; others make more obvious appeal back from a break.

runners.comment: Hooded all starts and hasn't progressed; needs to improve plenty on her turf debut
runners.spotlight: Hooded all starts and hasn't progressed, finishing a remote last and well behind Muy Muy Loco on Polytrack four weeks ago; needs to improve plenty on her turf debut.

races.race_name: Download The Star Sports App Handicap

runners.comment: Finally off the mark over C&D last Tuesday; decent claims but has more on under a penalty
runners.spotlight: Finally off the mark over C&D last Tuesday under Jack Doughty (since lost his 3lb claim and rides Cryptos Dream here); plenty in hand there and maybe that will take confidence to new levels but he has more on under a penalty.

runners.comment: Win and two seconds to his name in three runs over C&D; on a career-low mark; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Win and two seconds to his name in three runs over C&D and should do better now he's had a couple of runs back over 1m4f, especially with him on a career-low mark down from 0-65 company; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Has come a stone down the weights in the past year and time looks to be catching up
runners.spotlight: Short price for a 0-50 classified event on Polytrack at Lingfield ten weeks ago (dual winner there) when looking to have no excuses; come a stone down the weights in the past year and time looks to be catching up.

runners.comment: Can pull hard and has had 28 cracks at it under both codes
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who can pull hard, as has been the case twice over further since returned to turf; had little chance the way things unfolded last Monday but has had 28 cracks at it under both codes.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner for Jack Jones who enjoyed a consistent spring on the AW; considered
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner for Jack Jones who enjoyed a consistent spring on the AW; returns to turf, back from a short break, on her last winning mark and is one to consider.

runners.comment: Big price when well held from the front (Formal Address behind) at Windsor a fortnight ago
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW winner who's had plenty of chances on turf under both codes; big price when well held from the front (Formal Address well behind) at Windsor a fortnight ago.

runners.comment: Perhaps the hood will help him settle better; there are risks involved either way
runners.spotlight: Gone the wrong way since handicapping but his last run was too bad to be true and perhaps the hood will help him settle better; there are risks involved either way.

runners.comment: Maiden; often blown the start and can pull hard, so he comes with risks attached
runners.spotlight: Looked unlucky here in April, when getting well behind after a slow start over 1m, and his yard's in better form now than then; that's not the first time he's fluffed his lines at the stalls, though, and he can pull hard, so he comes with risks attached.

runners.comment: String of poor efforts (5f-1m) for three yards and looks of little account
runners.spotlight: String of poor efforts (5f-1m) for three yards and looks of little account; new trip not assured to suit on pedigree.

runners.comment: Would want to see good support on today's handicap debut before considering her
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two runs for Gary Moore as a 2yo; tailed off for her new yard early last month, back from a mammoth absence, and would want to see good support on today's handicap debut before considering her.

races.race_name: Star Sports "Confined" Handicap (For horses Which Have Not Won A Race In 2025)

runners.comment: Offered little on her comeback for new trainer and has to prove her stamina
runners.spotlight: Did a lot of her racing for the Kubler yard in sprints but proved fine over 7f last summer, including a win here; offered little on her comeback for new trainer (Local Bay looks his best shout) three weeks ago, however, and has to prove her stamina.

runners.comment: Four wins last summer, latterly off a 7lb higher mark; back in form here lately; player
runners.spotlight: Four wins last summer, latterly off a 7lb higher mark, and has come back to form round here lately; often blows the start and can pull hard, while it's late in the day to be trying headgear for the first time, but he remains quite capable if things fall right.

runners.comment: Stays further, is adaptable regarding tactics and holds obvious claims upped just 1lb
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner who's gone well fresh before and made a pleasing start for another new yard at Newmarket 17 days ago; stays further, is adaptable regarding tactics and holds obvious claims upped just 1lb.

runners.comment: Drop to 1m should suit; finished last in both runs this spring but ought to do much better
runners.spotlight: Gets away with 1m2f but she's pulled hard all four times she's tackled it and today's drop to 1m should suit; finished last in both runs this spring but ought to do much better.

runners.comment: Made much of the running before fading here on Friday (7f); will need to improve on that
runners.spotlight: Three-time Polytrack winner for the Crisford yard who's tumbled down the weights in recent times; made much of the running on his first turf start since 2022 before fading here on Friday (7f) and will need to improve on that.

races.race_name: starsports.bet Classified Stakes (Brighton Summer Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: More consistent than most at this level; holds each-way claims back from a short break
runners.spotlight: More consistent than most at this level, especially given her age, but doesn't win often now; drawn wide for last three runs at Wolverhampton and did pretty well in the circumstances; fine on turf and holds each-way claims back from a short break.

runners.comment: Won this race last year and bounced back to that level over C&D last time; leading claims
runners.spotlight: Won this race last year and bounced back to that level when a clear second for Phoebe Edwards over C&D early last month (Anglesey Lad fourth); holds leading claims.

runners.comment: Longstanding maiden who can pull hard; quite capable at this level but there are risks
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who can pull hard and has been turned over at 4-1 or shorter on seven occasions; clearly has the ability to win this but again beat himself back in blinkers (off today) behind Victors Dream over C&D last time and is far from without risk.

runners.comment: Serial hard-puller who's done most racing over 6f; well held here on Friday
runners.spotlight: Serial hard-puller who's done most racing over 6f, latterly in a hood; didn't see it out here on Friday and, although this is easier down in trip, there's a very good chance she'll over-race once more.

runners.comment: Achieved little in five starts on turf and has a bit to overcome back in cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: First ever run over 5f when never involved on Tapeta a month ago; achieved little in five previous starts on turf and has a bit to overcome back in cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Well behind two of today's rivals over C&D last time and is worse off with both
runners.spotlight: Sole win came more than two years ago and he has struggled of late; finished well behind two of today's rivals over C&D last time and is worse off with both.

runners.comment: Achieved little in four runs on turf and stall 9 isn't ideal for a front-runner
runners.spotlight: Three-time Lingfield winner last year who's achieved little in four runs on turf; this is easier back in cheekpieces but stall 9 isn't ideal for a front-runner and she wasn't at her best when last seen.

runners.comment: Poor maiden who's finished well beaten in two runs back from a year off; headgear goes on
runners.spotlight: Poor maiden who's finished well beaten in two runs back from a year off; first-time headgear will need to make quite a difference.

runners.comment: Achieved little in three runs on turf and has a bit to find at the weights
runners.spotlight: Best efforts have come under aggressive rides over 5f on Polytrack; achieved little in three runs on turf, including in blinkers last time, and reverts to the usual cheekpieces today (first-time tongue-tie added); bit to find at the weights.

races.race_name: Equisign Tack And Feed Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 7f Flat winner on soft ground; beaten 12l and 13l in her two races over hurdles
runners.spotlight: 7f Flat winner on soft ground; beaten 12l and 13l in her two races over hurdles after a long absence; needs more here, though has had wind surgery and tries a tongue-tie.

runners.comment: Outclassed in a Grade 2 at Aintree in April but won her two bumpers either side of that
runners.spotlight: Outclassed in a Grade 2 at Aintree in April but won her two bumpers either side of that, last time making all at Hexham; obvious claims on hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Beaten only a length by a talented mare in a Plumpton bumper in December
runners.spotlight: The race lacked depth but she was beaten only a length by a talented mare in a Plumpton bumper in December (good to soft); should win races over hurdles.

runners.comment: Had to dig deep to justify favouritism in a 2m good-ground bumper at Southwell
runners.spotlight: Travelled well but had to dig deep to justify favouritism in a 2m good-ground bumper at Southwell; bred to raise her profile over hurdles.

runners.comment: Beaten in ten bumpers but those runs weren't without promise; long-while absent
runners.spotlight: Beaten in ten bumpers but those runs weren't without promise and she needs a market check on hurdle/stable debut after her mammoth absence.

runners.comment: Not strong form when third in latest bumper but that's something to build on
runners.spotlight: Had made a thoroughly underwhelming start under rules but ran better after wind surgery and with a tongue-tie added at Plumpton (2m1f bumper, good); that's not strong form but it's something to build on.

runners.comment: Modest form on the Flat at up to 2m and unlikely to be making a winning start over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Modest form on the Flat at up to 2m and unlikely to be making a winning start over hurdles.

races.race_name: Oddschecker Free Bets Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Easy winner over hurdles here last time and should be on a good mark over fences
runners.spotlight: 0-9 over fences but twice runner-up; has another go in this discipline on the back of a comfortable win over hurdles here (2m4f, good) in a race he also won 12 months earlier; now rated 10lb lower as a chaser so has obvious claims.

runners.comment: Continues to be let down by his jumping; cheekpieces may help in that respect
runners.spotlight: Ran encouragingly on chase debut here but not built on that and continues to be let down by his jumping; cheekpieces may help in that respect and he would have claims with a trouble-free round.

runners.comment: 3m winner at Fakenham in April and has continued to run well at shorter trips
runners.spotlight: Clearcut winner at Fakenham in April (3m, good) and has continued to run well at shorter trips; should stay out of any trouble in front and can go well.

runners.comment: A three-time winner over fences but little to shout about for a while now
runners.spotlight: A three-time winner over fences but little to shout about for a while now and finished last of the four runners on stable debut.

runners.comment: Capable on his day but very hit and miss and below par in his last three races
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back handicap chases last May and staged a revival when second at Ffos Las this April; very hit and miss, though, and has been well beaten in his last three races.

runners.comment: Hurdle/chase winner; none too consistent but found only one too good last time at Perth
runners.spotlight: Hurdle/chase winner; none too consistent but found only one too good last time at Perth (3m, good) and won't be far away if able to repeat that form.

runners.comment: The winner of three hurdle races but yet to land a handicap; 0-4 over fences
runners.spotlight: The winner of three hurdle races but yet to land a handicap and he's 0-4 over fences; wasn't in any form over hurdles when last seen 11 months ago.

runners.comment: Only 1-22 under rules and lengthy breaks are a feature in his profile
runners.spotlight: Only 1-22 under rules and lengthy breaks are a feature in his profile; pulled up on his only previous attempt at chasing and ran a very laboured race over hurdles last time at Huntingdon.

races.race_name: Get The Best Odds With Oddschecker Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Now back with his former trainer, he could be interesting off this low a mark
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise over hurdles for Fergal O'Brien in 2022-23 and has steadily found his form in points since returning from an absence; now back with his former trainer, he could be interesting off this low a mark.

runners.comment: Up against it in a maiden last time and has brighter prospects at this level
runners.spotlight: 0-11; ran respectably when up against it in a maiden last time and has brighter prospects at this level; others still appeal more.

runners.comment: Had a wind op since an improved second from the front at Worcester in March
runners.spotlight: Ran well from the front to be runner-up at Worcester in March (2m4f, good) and has since undergone wind surgery; fair shout if she has turned a corner.

runners.comment: Had wind surgery since failing favourite backers at Perth in April; hard to dismiss
runners.spotlight: 10l winner off 1lb higher over this trip on good ground at Perth last September; encouraging run on his penultimate start and had wind surgery since failing favourite backers at Perth in April; hard to dismiss.

runners.comment: Two good runs after wind surgery and travelled noticeably well the last time
runners.spotlight: Looks all the better for wind surgery having finished close up from off the pace at Worcester (2m3f, good) and backed that up with another sound effort at Newton Abbot (2m2f, good; second won since); travelled strongly the last time and kept on; big chance off 1lb lower.

runners.comment: Just two runs since sole win; comes with some risks after another absence
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m4f handicap hurdle off 5lb lower at Perth in June 2022 and confined to only two appearances in the meantime; now returns from another absence and hard to know what to expect.

runners.comment: Back from an absence to finish third over C&D and might well build on that
runners.spotlight: 0-8; ran well for a long way on his return from an absence to be a well-held third behind previous-race contender Iron Heart over C&D 24 days ago; should build on that.

runners.comment: Ten-race maiden on his third yard; first run for current stable was better than the second
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden on his third yard; first run for Annabelle Sowray was mildly encouraging but that was over 2m7f at Hexham, where he disappointed 13 days ago; wouldn't be the percentage call.

races.race_name: Oddschecker Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Consistent 8yo who ran well last time but this is a higher grade than he's accustomed to
runners.spotlight: Won over 2m2f here in September and two solid efforts in the meantime, latterly staying on well over 2m at Aintree; however, this is a higher grade than he's accustomed to.

runners.comment: 4-6 for this yard; gave it another good go from the front at Warwick three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-6 for this yard and gave it another good go from the front at Warwick three weeks ago (2m5f, good); 2lb higher here with Beau Morgan again taking away 5lb; every chance.

runners.comment: Long odds-on winner of a maiden last time; could be well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Useful Flat racer who was off the mark over hurdles at the fifth attempt when long odds-on for a 2m maiden at Worcester; that told us nothing but, given his Flat ability, he should be well treated for this handicap debut.

runners.comment: Goes well fresh and returned from a break with a win at Uttoxeter; up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Lost his way last season but goes well fresh and returned from a break with a win at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good), the front two coming clear; 3lb rise isn't too damaging and he can hold his form.

runners.comment: The mare she beat narrowly over 2m7f here last month won at Stratford on Saturday
runners.spotlight: Has returned from a good absence in fine form and the mare she beat narrowly over 2m7f here last month won at Stratford on Saturday; this 7yo has to go well again off 4lb higher.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Worcester a month ago but inconsistency a feature in his profile
runners.spotlight: Inconsistency a feature in his profile so whether he'll back up his recent second at Worcester (2m7f, good) remains to be seen; clearly has a chance if he can.

runners.comment: Edged home at Perth in just his second handicap; up 5lb but remains lightly raced
runners.spotlight: Only his second run in a handicap when showing a willing spirit to prevail narrowly at Perth (2m4f, good); raised 5lb but appeals as a lightly raced 8yo with more to offer.

races.race_name: Bet Smarter With Oddschecker+ Novices' Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Up 10lb for winning so well at Newton Abbot but he's a young chaser on the upgrade
runners.spotlight: Thumped to the tune of 10lb for winning so well at Newton Abbot (2m, good) but he looks a chaser on the upgrade and again has his optimum conditions.

runners.comment: Beaten 8l by the winner on chase debut at Stratford but jumped well
runners.spotlight: 1-8 over hurdles; beaten 8l by the winner on chase debut at Stratford (2m1f, good; same mark) but she wasn't let down by her jumping and should go well again.

runners.comment: Both wins here but might be vulnerable off his current mark
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been here, the latest over C&D in April when visored for the first time; couldn't defy a 4lb rise at Huntingdon and seemed to see out the 2m4f okay; should run well but might be vulnerable.

runners.comment: Doesn't look ahead of his mark which hasn't really gone anywhere
runners.spotlight: Seems to be getting his act together over fences as his last three runs have been much better; however, doesn't look ahead of his mark which hasn't really gone anywhere.

runners.comment: Modest form under rules, including when 28-1 for handicap debut in March; chase debut
runners.spotlight: Finished second in a point but modest form under rules, including when 28-1 for handicap debut in March (2m3f, good to soft); has a lot to find but perhaps fences will be the making of him.

runners.comment: Ran a tad better in his second handicap last time at Stratford; form franked on Saturday
runners.spotlight: Ran a tad better in his second handicap hurdle last time at Stratford (2m2f, good) and the runner-up made all there on Saturday evening; dropped 4lb and might have a say if taking to fences.

runners.comment: Lightly raced but hard to glean too many positives from any of his runs over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced but hard to glean too many positives from any of his runs over hurdles, including a handicap; can only be watched now chasing.

runners.comment: Poor hurdler and don't see him making a better chaser; out of the weights
runners.spotlight: The last of his Flat wins was in 2021; poor hurdler and don't see him making a better chaser; out of the weights.

races.race_name: Market Rasen Annual Badgeholder Tipster Champion Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Flat winner; best run yet over hurdles could be on the cards now into a handicap
runners.spotlight: 1m6f winner on the AW in October; back from a break to finish a remote third in a Stratford novice; will like the ground for this handicap debut and his best run yet over hurdles could be on the cards.

runners.comment: This Flat winner has yet to strike over hurdles but there's time yet with him only five
runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Huntingdon in October (2m3f, good) but a couple of no-shows afterwards and now returns from a break after changing yards (same owners); this Flat winner has yet to strike over hurdles but there's time yet with him only five.

runners.comment: Three Flat wins since joining this yard and wasn't beaten far in his latest hurdle
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish gelding who has had seven races for James Owen and won three times on the Flat, the latest at Brighton (1m4f, good) 12 days ago; wasn't beaten far over hurdles the time before; should go well.

runners.comment: Longstanding maiden but placed again when third over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden but placed again when third over C&D last month and that and other runs suggest his turn should come.

runners.comment: Often runs well and nothing wrong with her mark; had wind surgery during her break
runners.spotlight: Won here in August 2023 (2m2f, good), which remains her sole success in 21 starts over hurdles; however, she often runs well and there's nothing wrong with her mark; had wind surgery during her break.

runners.comment: On a good mark if as good as he was after an absence; market may guide
runners.spotlight: Consistent once sent into handicaps until disappointing on his final outing in September 2023; something was evidently amiss given subsequent absence and trainer can get them fit at home; on a good mark.

runners.comment: Disappointing on the Flat and hasn't exactly hit the ground running over hurdles
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden who became disappointing on the Flat and hasn't exactly hit the ground running over hurdles, going down by between 17l and 24l in his qualifying races; clearly entitled to do better now handicapping but he's unconvincing.

runners.comment: 0-12 as a hurdler and has no worthwhile form since moving to Britain
runners.spotlight: Four Flat wins in Ireland when the mud was flying; 0-12 as a hurdler and has no worthwhile form since moving to Britain.

races.race_name: Download The Oddschecker App Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 4-1 for a Plumpton bumper (2m1f, good) and kept the favourite honest
runners.spotlight: 4-1 for a Plumpton bumper (2m1f, good) and kept the favourite honest with 5l back to Kill The Groove who runs in the opening race here; obvious chance.

runners.comment: Travelled well to a point at Huntingdon in February but trailed in last; now tongue tied
runners.spotlight: Travelled well to a point at Huntingdon in February but trailed in last (good to soft; 9-1); cost 50,000euros as a 3yo and now goes in a tongue-tie; could easily show more here.

runners.comment: They went no pace at Ascot so probably flattered; then finished tailed off next time
runners.spotlight: Probably flattered to finish so close on Ascot debut as they went no pace; then went off 33-1 at Southwell and finished tailed off; new trainer.

runners.comment: First foal; dam unplaced French 10.5f/1m3f Flat and 2m1f/2m2f hurdles
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam unplaced French 10.5f/1m3f Flat and 2m1f/2m2f hurdles, half-sister to French/Italian 2m1f-2m3f hurdle/chase winner Accelerator; stable has occasional success in these races and this isn't at all strong.

races.race_name: Eat In The White Rose Bistro Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Made debut over 6f at Newmarket when second to a potentially top-class colt
runners.spotlight: 200,000gns yearling with a smart pedigree; drops back in trip having made his debut over 6f at Newmarket (good to firm) where he beat all bar Godolphin's well regarded and Ascot-bound Treanmor; hard to beat.

runners.comment: Comfortably beaten in two 6f maidens and handicaps will be more like it
runners.spotlight: Comfortably beaten in two 6f maidens and handicaps will be more like it.

runners.comment: Finished last at Ripon (6f, good; 11-1) after losing all hope at the start
runners.spotlight: Finished last at Ripon (6f, good; 11-1) after losing all hope at the start; should be wiser this time if nothing else.

runners.comment: Second foal; dam placed 1m AW (RPR 76); an unlikely winner first time out
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam placed 1m AW (RPR 76), out of unraced sister to Italian 1m Group 2 winner Oriental Fashion and half-sister to US 1m2f Grade 2 winner Makderah; an unlikely winner first time out.

runners.comment: £30,000 breeze-up buy in April; ninth foal; brother to smart 5f-6f winner Stone Of Destiny
runners.spotlight: £30,000 breeze-up buy in April; ninth foal; brother to 5f-6f winner Stone Of Destiny (RPR 109) and half-brother to four further winners; top Newmarket stable is 7-21 here; faces a tough rival in Vlad but has to be of interest.

runners.comment: £160,000 breeze-up 2yo; second foal out of a 5f 2yo winner; interesting
runners.spotlight: £160,000 breeze-up 2yo; second foal out of a 5f 2yo winner (RPR 94); makes debut with his yard going well, including their 2yos.

races.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands B-D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Runner-up at Bath on second start, when still looking a work in progress; player
runners.spotlight: Promising fifth of 15 on debut at Leicester (5f, good) in April and built on that when second at Bath (5.7f, firm); still looked a work in progress on that latest start and she's open to further improvement; player.

runners.comment: Promising third on debut at Chepstow and every chance she'll progress; one to consider
runners.spotlight: 9-2, showed good pace when third on debut at Chepstow (5f, good) three weeks ago; her dam was a useful 2yo and there's every chance she'll progress for her powerful 2yo stable; she's one to consider.

runners.comment: Close second at Thirsk on second start and has leading claims on the back of that
runners.spotlight: Left April's debut (5f, good) behind when close second at Thirsk (5f, good to firm) last time, keeping on well after being carried left by the winner; leading claims on the back of that latest performance.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten fourth of five at 25-1 on debut at Ripon; considerable improvement needed
runners.spotlight: £52,000 yearling who made debut in warm novice at Ripon (5f, good) in April but was a soundly beaten fourth of five at 25-1 and considerable improvement is needed.

runners.comment: Big odds and well beaten on both starts (5f/6f, good); hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Big odds and well beaten on both starts (5f/6f, good); hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Half-sister to 4 winners; trainer's 2yos are going well; could have part to play on debut
runners.spotlight: 6,500gns foal, £40,000 yearling; ninth foal; Sergei Prokofiev half-sister to four winners notably Light In Paris (7f-8.5f including 2yo; RPR 102); dam French 1m 2yo winner (97); trainer's 2yos are going well and she could have a part to play on debut.

runners.comment: 45,000gns yearling; first foal; dam 5f-1m winner (including 2yo/US stakes); not ruled out
runners.spotlight: 45,000gns yearling; first foal; dam 5f-1m winner (including 2yo/US stakes), half-sister to two winners; her trainer (who runs two) is having a good season with his 2yos and this Dark Angel newcomer is not ruled out.

runners.comment: Half-sister to seven winners; pedigree catches the eye & she could be a contender on debut
runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; Washington DC half-sister to seven winners notably Majestic Beauty (Listed-placed 5f 2yo; RPR 98) and Mr Wizard (6f 2yo; 97); pedigree catches the eye and she could be a contender on debut.

runners.comment: Has a precocious pedigree and her trainer can ready one first time; chance
runners.spotlight: 42,000gns yearling; first foal; dam 5f winner (including 2yo; RPR 92), sister to winners Lydia's Place (5f including 2yo) and Lawless Louis (5f/6f including 2yo), out of 5f 2yo winner; this Sergei Prokofiev newcomer has a precocious pedigree and her trainer can ready one first time; chance.

runners.comment: £6,000 yearling; fellow newcomer Rum Therapy may be stable's chief hope under David Allan
runners.spotlight: £6,000 yearling; by Sergei Prokofiev; first foal; unraced dam closely related to 1m 2yo Listed winner Coupe De Ville; fellow newcomer Rum Therapy may be the stable's chief hope under David Allan.

races.race_name: Heineken 0.0 Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: Two 7f AW wins last August/September but below par in February on sole run this season
runners.spotlight: Two 7f AW wins last August/September and she went close on turf in between; however, she was below par at Southwell (7f, AW) in February after 112 days off and returns from another break today.

runners.comment: 0-10 but placed the last twice, going close most recently; a first win may be imminent
runners.spotlight: 0-10 but has run well with this tongue-tie added the last twice, finishing third at Newmarket (1m, good) then going close at Leicester (6f, good to soft) last Tuesday; a first win may be imminent.

runners.comment: Went close on final outing for the Crisfords and could be involved on stable debut
runners.spotlight: 0-8 for the Crisfords but ran well at Nottingham (1m, good/good to firm) in April on final two outings for that yard, going close most recently; makes stable debut having been bought for 25,000gns and could be involved.

runners.comment: Beaten a long way on reappearance but may have needed it & she's down to a dangerous mark
runners.spotlight: 0-13 since debut win in June 2023 and beaten a long way on reappearance at Beverley in April; however, she may have needed the run, over an 8.4f trip that stretches her, and she's well treated on last year's best form.

runners.comment: Fair 4th at Leicester in April; might not be far away if back on song now in cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Emphatic win at Kempton (7f, AW) in February and fair fourth back on turf at Leicester (7f, good) in April; down the field at Kempton (7f, AW) since but she's now 4lb lower than at Leicester and she might not be far away if returning to form in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Returned to form when third at Hamilton; pedigree provides hope about this step up to 7f
runners.spotlight: 6f 2yo maiden winner last June who returned to form when third of six at Hamilton (6f, good to firm) last time; tackles 7f for the first time but her pedigree provides optimism it will suit and she's a possible.

runners.comment: Yet to prove she stays 7f but it's worth another go and she arrives in pretty good heart
runners.spotlight: Yet to prove she stays 7f but hasn't had many attempts and has kept on well over 6f on her last few starts, suggesting this trip is worth another go; arrives in pretty good heart and she's on the shortlist.

runners.comment: 0-12 but has run really well on two of her three starts this season; knocking at the door
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden but she was an unlucky fourth at Musselburgh (7f, good) on her reappearance and returned to form with a close third at Ayr (7f, good to firm); knocking at the door.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten last week but in good form previously; could be thereabouts if back on song
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten at Redcar last Monday when reportedly hanging right-handed throughout; however, she posted two good efforts previously (including over C&D) and could be thereabouts if swiftly back on song.

runners.comment: Fly-leapt leaving stalls when well beaten at Beverley but in good form earlier this year
runners.spotlight: Beaten 18 times since her last win in August 2023 and she can be quirky before the start (fly-leapt leaving stalls when well beaten at Beverley last time); however, she was in good form on AW earlier this year and could be in the mix if avoiding mishap.

runners.comment: Displayed ability last August/September but down the field in all three handicaps
runners.spotlight: Displayed ability last August/September among her first three starts but down the field in all three handicaps, most recently on reappearance at Wolverhampton where she reared at the start; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Hasn't kicked on from last July's promising debut but still of interest in her first h'cap
runners.spotlight: Encouraging fourth on her debut at Thirsk (7f, good to firm) last July; just two runs since, with lesser performances each time, but she has potential off this opening mark if tapping back into her initial promise.

runners.comment: Promising start to career last summer but not at the same level this year and now 0-9
runners.spotlight: She made a promising start to her career last summer and is on a handy mark on that form; however, she hasn't been at the same level this year and is now 0-9; needs something extra on this first crack at 7f.

races.race_name: Come Racing Again On 19th June Handicap

runners.comment: Runner-up on handicap debut at Redcar then had an excuse at Doncaster; retains potential
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at Doncaster (1m, good to firm) last time but clipped heels and stumbled badly early in the race; prior to that he was a good second on handicap debut at Redcar (1m, good to firm) and shaped as though he may be suited by today's extra distance; retains potential.

runners.comment: Fair 1m2f fourth on the second of his three starts and not discounted on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Made debut in March and fair fourth at Beverley (1m2f, good) in April on second start; a lesser run followed at Ayr (1m, good) four days later but he's not discounted now back up in trip on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Went close on debut last September but unable to reproduce that form on his 5 runs since
runners.spotlight: Went close on debut at Newcastle (7f, AW) last September but unable to reproduce that form on his five runs since; soundly beaten at Haydock (1m2f, good to firm) most recently with these cheekpieces applied.

runners.comment: Elements of pedigree suggest this step up in trip will suit; not ruled out on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Has improved with each of his three runs and was a fair fifth of 14 at Ayr (1m, good) last time; elements of his useful pedigree suggest this step up in trip will suit and he's not ruled out on his handicap debut.

runners.comment: Won 7f 2yo maiden last June but didn't progress and tailed off on stable debut in April
runners.spotlight: Won Newcastle maiden (7f, AW) last June for Phil Makin but below par in the autumn on final two runs for that yard and tailed off at 25-1 on his seasonal and stable debut at Pontefract in April; plenty to prove.

runners.comment: Yet to threaten but cost 115,000euros and a market check is advised on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Unable to threaten on her three starts and tailed off at Chester last time when upped to 1m2f; however, this attractively bred filly cost 115,000euros at the breeze-ups last May and is one to watch in the betting off a modest mark on her handicap debut.

runners.comment: Has shown ability across her three starts and she's not ruled out on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability across her three starts, most recently 8l third of six in Lingfield novice (1m2f, AW); this handicap debut provides a more realistic opportunity and she's not ruled out.

runners.comment: Well beaten at 100-1 on nursery debut at Pontefract last October and absent since
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to two winners for whom soft ground may not have suited on nursery debut at Pontefract (1m, soft) last October; however, he was 100-1 and has been absent since; his claims aren't compelling.

runners.comment: Dam was a 1m5f-2m winner and he could be a big improver now up in trip on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Made debut in April and hasn't achieved much on his first three starts, at big odds each time (8.6f/7f); however, his dam was a 1m5f-2m winner and he could be a big improver now up in trip on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Close fourth on handicap debut at Doncaster and that form reads well; on the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Showed improved form when upped in trip and close fourth of eight on seasonal and handicap debut at Doncaster (1m2f, good) in May; that form reads well and she could have more to offer; on the shortlist.

runners.comment: Fair efforts the last twice but needs something extra to get off the mark at 13th attempt
runners.spotlight: Fair efforts in defeat the last twice at Chantilly (9.5f, AW) and Wolverhampton (1m4f, AW); however, he needs something extra today if he's to get off the mark at the 13th attempt.

races.race_name: Live Streams On Racing TV Extra Handicap

runners.comment: Hold-up performer who'll always be reliant on some luck; player upped 3lb if getting some
runners.spotlight: Hold-up performer who'll always be reliant on some luck, something she hadn't had a couple of times this spring before winning a fortnight ago; up 3lb to a career-high mark and she has stall 9, but a leading player.

runners.comment: Useful in the past but usually finds a way of losing these days; capable off this mark
runners.spotlight: Useful in the past but usually finds a way of losing these days; still more than capable off this mark but a slow start is quite likely and he often pulls hard, so there will always be risks.

runners.comment: Consistent enough, often from the front, but is an infrequent winner; drops from 7f
runners.spotlight: Consistent enough, often from the front, but is an infrequent winner; only dipped below 6f twice in the past, this spring's two runs coming over 7f, and she'll need one of her better breaks if she's to capitalise on stall 1.

runners.comment: Would have preferred some rain; share of defeats at short prices in recent times
runners.spotlight: Ran well on fast turf last time but was said to have never travelled when a beaten-favourite on good to firm last summer; had his share of defeats at short prices in recent times for a yard also responsible for Carlton And Co.

runners.comment: Propensity to hang right wouldn't be ideal round here but he enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Six wins last year, three on Tapeta and three on turf, all over 5f; back in form at Redcar a month ago, when chasing home a subsequent winner and, while a propensity to hang right wouldn't be ideal round here, he enters calculations.

runners.comment: Best over 5f and stall 10 isn't ideal for one happiest on the sharp end; bit to overcome
runners.spotlight: Return to an easier course will help but he's always looked best served by 5f and stall 10 isn't ideal for one happiest on the sharp end; bit to overcome in that case.

runners.comment: Found her level again lately; claims if settling better in the first-time hood
runners.spotlight: Tumbled down the weights since being picked up from Karl Burke for 30,000gns last summer and has found her level again lately; pulled hard and didn't see it out back up to 6f last time and has claims if settling better in the first-time hood.

runners.comment: Entitled to have needed his recent comeback but didn't offer much hope in finishing last
runners.spotlight: Expensive to follow for Clive Cox last year before being picked up for 16,000gns in the autumn; entitled to have needed his recent comeback but didn't offer any immediate hope in finishing last.

runners.comment: 4lb below last winning mark; needs to break better and improve on two previous turf runs
runners.spotlight: Generally kept to the AW by Ivan Furtado, doing her racing over 6f-7f; now 4lb below her last winning mark, having offered more last time, but will need to break better than has often been the case and improve on two previous turf efforts.

runners.comment: Well treated again but hasn't offered much in four runs for her new yard
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW winner for Dylan Cunha in the early months of last year; well treated again but hasn't offered much in four runs for her new yard and the return to turf will need to help.

races.race_name: Birra Moretti Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Won his first two starts in 2025 (1m, good to firm); well held in Class 3 latest; new trip
runners.spotlight: Gelded at the end of his 3yo campaign and duly won his first two runs this season, both 1m handicaps on good to firm (one of them at this track); not so good upped to Class 3 company at Haydock nine days ago but this grade should be in range; new, longer trip needs to spark extra.

runners.comment: Good effort on stable/seasonal debut last month; mark looks fair but other pace on show
runners.spotlight: Won twice for Charles Hills, including 1m2f on fast ground, and he ran well on his stable/seasonal debut at Hamilton last month (1m1f, good to firm), beaten around half a length into third (strong favourite); has races in him off this sort of mark but he could face competition for the lead here.

runners.comment: 0-10 on turf and beaten 4l when second last time; has a rare run over 1m2f today
runners.spotlight: 0-10 on turf and his latest second at Lingfield (7.6f, good to firm) saw him beaten 4l; has his first run over 1m2f since September 2022 and while it looks an avenue worth exploring, others appeal more for win purposes.

runners.comment: Infrequent winner; work to do with Bodorgan on latest run; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Only 1lb higher than for his AW success (1m) in March; respectable efforts on his last two starts but he does have work to do with Bodorgan on latest Hamilton run.

runners.comment: Looked in need of the run on his seasonal/handicap debut; bred to be better than this mark
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in three quick novice/maiden runs last summer; gelded over the winter and raced as though his reappearance effort at Hamilton (behind a couple of these) would bring him on; bred to be better than this mark and he's unexposed.

runners.comment: Runner-up in six of his 12 starts, including last two; cheekpieces could help him focus
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden but he's been second six times, including his last two starts (second and third runs for new yard); looks on a competitive mark and any improvement for the new cheekpieces would see him bang there.

runners.comment: Four wins last year, including over C&D on this card; didn't run badly at York latest
runners.spotlight: Won four 1m2f handicaps last year, breaking his duck in the 3yo handicap over C&D on this card 12 months ago and adding further success at Doncaster, Beverley and Redcar; unplaced in two runs this time around but he finished his race off well at York 19 days ago and could be building to something better.

runners.comment: Another good Ayr run when third 12 days ago but more will be needed in this field
runners.spotlight: Did most of his racing at Ayr last year and enjoyed success, winning twice over 1m2f; ran right up to his best back at Ayr 12 days ago but he will need more to come out on top here.

runners.comment: 1m AW win in March but only 7th of 8 on handicap debut latest; new trip should suit
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m maiden at Southwell in March but he dropped away to finish seventh of eight on his handicap debut at Newcastle last month; this trip likely to suit but not sure he's well treated.

races.race_name: Book Tickets Online At wetherbyracing.co.uk Handicap

runners.comment: AW win (5f) in November; 2025 best gives him claims and this intermediate trip should suit
runners.spotlight: Ran well enough at Nottingham in April to think turf was fine and he's feasibly weighted on his best form; hasn't landed a blow the last twice but something bigger could be brewing and this trip should suit.

runners.comment: Unplaced in all eight starts but has hinted at winning potential; interesting contender
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all eight starts but he has shown promise and looked ready to exploit a reduced mark when fourth at Hamilton last month (6f, good to firm; held up and met trouble); Paul Mulrennan booked; of interest in a modest event.

runners.comment: Progressing at a low level this spring; likely to be in the shake-up once again
runners.spotlight: Getting the hang of things this spring, winning at Bath (5.7f, firm) and a solid third at Nottingham five days later (5f, good to firm); should remain competitive.

runners.comment: Shock AW win in December and ran well one week later; low-key return to turf six weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Sprung a 125-1 surprise at Newcastle in December (6f) and ran with credit at Southwell one week later; low-key return to turf at Redcar six weeks ago; still early days but not a solid option.

runners.comment: One York run last summer that gives him strong claims; return to sprinting is a plus
runners.spotlight: Third of 13 at York on last summer's nursery debut and he's of serious interest if returning to that level (now 8lb lower); well held in two runs this year but they were over 7f and 1m; market useful now back sprinting.

runners.comment: Improved effort when 2nd to a thriving rival at Ripon on her return (6f, good); unexposed
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress as a 2yo but she showed improvement when second to a thriving rival at Ripon (6f, good) on last month's reappearance; can do better.

runners.comment: No impact in two 5f runs this year but down the weights and this trip should suit
runners.spotlight: Hasn't landed a blow in two 5f handicaps this year but slipping down the weights and today's extra yardage looks a positive; revival could be imminent.

runners.comment: Peak RPR of just 30 and well beaten in a seller three weeks ago; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Peak RPR of just 30 and well beaten in a seller three weeks ago.

races.race_name: Download The Raceday Ready App Confined Handicap (Won No More Than One Race)

runners.comment: Won AW maiden last month and she still has potential; possibilities on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Off the mark (seventh attempt) when justifying favouritism in Chelmsford maiden (6f, AW)  on her return last month; this is tougher on handicap debut but her confidence should be boosted after that success and she ran well over C&D (good to firm) last summer; possibilities.

runners.comment: Close up on stable debut at Doncaster and had excuse there latest; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: 6f maiden winner (good to soft) for George Boughey last September; made good start for new yard when close third in Doncaster handicap (6f, good to firm) and she got squeezed out at the start on her return visit last month; now drops back in grade and has possibilities if she can get back near best.

runners.comment: Back from lengthy absence with clear second at Newmarket; big player off only 1lb higher
runners.spotlight: Won on handicap debut at Lingfield (6f, soft) last July and he returned after a gelding operation with clear second behind a big improver at Newmarket (6f, good) last month; should benefit from that comeback run and he's open to more progress off only 1lb higher here; interesting contender.

runners.comment: Didn't get much luck when third at Doncaster and she's respected back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Won by a nose in a Southwell maiden (5f, AW) in April before a narrow defeat back in a handicap at Doncaster (5f, good to firm) last time; had some traffic issues in that race and she's only 1lb higher on this step back up in trip; dangerous for in-form yard.

runners.comment: Wolverhampton winner (6f), who ran well at Kempton on return in March; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Made her breakthrough with cheekpieces added in a Wolverhampton maiden (6f) in September; subsequent heavy-ground flop easy to forgive and she made a solid return when third over 7f at Kempton in March; this return to sprinting looks a good move and she should have more to offer in handicaps; withdrawn after getting upset in stalls at Kempton last month.

runners.comment: C&D winner who has reached the frame in three handicaps this season; respected
runners.spotlight: Won a C&D novice (good to firm) on her second 2yo run; 0-8 since but she's reached the frame in three handicaps this season including a second at Kempton in April and a rallying third behind an improver over C&D last Saturday; should be in the mix again and she's respected.

runners.comment: Placed in three of her five qualifying runs and she's looks interesting on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Placed in three of her five qualifying runs including a rallying second on her Wolverhampton reappearance (6f maiden) in April; conditions should be fine on this return to turf and this unexposed filly needs a close look on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Has not gone on since her maiden win at Thirsk last summer and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Won a Thirsk fillies' novice (5f, good to firm) for Karl Burke last summer but she's not gone on from that in four runs for new yard this year; had hopeless task in Listed race on AW last time but she still looks on a high enough mark for handicaps and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Eight-race maiden and he's been well below form in two runs for new yard this season
runners.spotlight: Promise for Michael O'Callaghan in Ireland as a 2yo but he's been well below form in two 6f runs (maiden/handicap) for new yard this season; dropped 4lb but he's now 0-8 and others are more convincing; has worn headgear in last four starts but not today.

runners.comment: 0-7 since his debut win and was last of 12 at Newmarket 17 days ago; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Won at Newmarket (6f, good) on debut last May but he's 0-7 since and was a long behind Forever My Prince in a Newmarket handicap (last of 12) last month; visor is now tried and he needs to bounce back again.

runners.comment: No joy in her three handicaps and was always in rear last time; down the list
runners.spotlight: Won a Wolverhampton maiden (6f, AW) in March; didn't get much luck in her first two handicaps but was always in rear at Kempton last month and has bit to prove after that laboured effort.

races.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: No match for odds-on rival at Thirsk (5f) but that was an encouraging start; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Out of a useful 7f 2yo winner; no match for an odds-on rival when second of four at Thirsk (5f, good to firm; 14-1) in April but that was an encouraging debut and he's open to progress on this step up in trip; refused to enter the stalls at Chester last month and been gelded since.

runners.comment: Made a promising start when runner-up at Chepstow and sets good standard on that form
runners.spotlight: 45,000gns breeze-up purchase who is out of unraced half-sister to top-class sprinter Blue Point; 100-30 at Chepstow (6f, good) last month and he travelled well for a long way before finishing runner-up behind a useful prospect; that was a promising start and he sets a good standard on that form.

runners.comment: Down the field at a big price on Chepstow debut and was 5l behind Blue Orbit
runners.spotlight: Finished down the field at a big price on Chepstow debut last month and was 5l behind the runner-up Blue Orbit; yard runs three here and she remains best watched for now.

runners.comment: Showed promise on Salisbury debut and he's a likely improver on this step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Lucky Vega colt who has plenty of stamina in his good pedigree; finished fourth of eight when second-favourite on Salisbury debut (5f, good to firm) last month but he shaped with promise and wasn't beaten far; should know more this time and he's a likely improver upped in trip.

runners.comment: 100-1 and she finished 7l behind Blue Orbit on Chepstow debut (6f, good) last month
runners.spotlight: 100-1 and she finished 7l behind Blue Orbit on Chepstow debut (seventh of eight) last month; opposable.

runners.comment: Has good target to aim at on debut and he could be a longer-term prospect
runners.spotlight: £45,000 yearling; fourth foal; half-brother to 1m6f/2m AW winner Barrel Aged (RPR 82); dam Listed-placed 1m2f winner (104), half-sister to Japanese winners Admire Virgo (1m2f Listed) and Satono Solomon (Group-placed 1m/1m2f), out of French 1,000 Guineas winner; has good target to aim at on debut and he could be a longer-term prospect.

runners.comment: 150,000gns half-brother to 12 winners; striking newcomer and he needs a close look
runners.spotlight: 150,000gns yearling; half-brother to 12 winners including Mammas Girl (7f including 2yo/Group 3; RPR 108), Master Of War (6f-1m including 2yo Listed; 108) and Arabie (6f 2yo including Group 2; 103); dam placed 1m2f-10.6f (77), out of smart 6f 2yo winner; striking newcomer and he need a close look in market.

runners.comment: 100,000gns yearling; yard 19% with 2yos here in recent years; interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: 100,000gns yearling; second foal; dam 1m/8.6f winner (RPR 87), closely related to smart 6f/7f winner Dreamfield (including 2yo), half-sister to winners Prince Eiji (UAE 1m dirt Group 3) and Willie John (smart 7f 2yo/1m2f), out of 1m2f Group 1 winner Izzi Top; yard 19% with 2yos here in recent years and he needs watching in market on debut.

runners.comment: Has plenty of stamina on dam's side and he could be one for later on
runners.spotlight: 11,500euros foal, 24,000gns yearling; first foal; dam 1m5f/2m AW winner (RPR 87), half-sister to winners Leadership (UAE 7f/1m) and Blue Hue (French 9.5f/9.7f), out of Group-placed 1m-10.4f winner; has plenty of stamina on dam's side and he could be one for later on.

runners.comment: One of three runners for yard and is probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 9.4f AW/1m4f turf winner (RPR 89), half-sister to useful 1m/8.4f winner Mange All, is granddaughter of Listed-placed 6f winner; one of three runners for yard and is probably best watched on debut.

runners.comment: Looks more of a middle-distance prospect on paper and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; gelded half-brother to KSA 1m2f winner Mutanather; dam unraced half-sister to winners Santa Sophia (1m4f Listed) and Sanchi (useful 1m2f/1m3f); looks more of a middle-distance prospect on paper and others are preferred.

runners.comment: £34,000 yearling; yard 20% with 2yos this season and he needs watching in market
runners.spotlight: 5,500euros foal, £34,000 yearling; seventh foal; half-brother to Polish 9.5f winner Singers Star; dam Listed-placed 1m AW winner (including 2yo; RPR 93), half-sister to Listed-placed 7f-8.5f winner Clara Peeters, out of maiden half-sister to HK 1m2f Group 1 winner Mensa; yard 20% with 2yos this season and interesting to see how he figures in market.

runners.comment: Yard 10% with 2yos last year and market should guide on debut.
runners.spotlight: 62,000gns foal; brother to 5.5f-6.5f winner Room Service (including 2yo/Listed; RPR 115), half-brother to winners Royal Advice (6f/7f; 80) and Green Clover (Polish 1m-1m2f including 2yo); dam placed 8.6f/1m1f, out of 1m4f/1m5f winner; yard 10% with 2yos last year and market should guide on debut.

runners.comment: Already been gelded and this looks a tough enough starting point
runners.spotlight: £16,000 yearling; first foal; dam Hungarian 5f/5.5f winner, half-sister to winners Diligent Harry (5f/6f Listed) and Harry Three (6f Listed), out of maiden half-sister to 6f Group 2 winner Temple Meads; already been gelded and this looks a tough enough starting point.

races.race_name: Download The Fitzdares App Now Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Won at Kempton in October when she beat a subsequent Listed runner-up; respected on return
runners.spotlight: Gave a red-hot favourite a scare on her Kempton debut (6f, AW) in September and she justified favouritism on her return visit the following month; finished well to beat a subsequent Listed runner-up last time and she's strongly respected under a penalty on her return.

runners.comment: Shown promise in both her runs and she could have a big role to play back on turf
runners.spotlight: 7-2 when a promising second on her Salisbury debut (6f, good to firm) last summer; didn't build on that when fourth at Wolverhampton in April but that was from a tough draw and she wasn't far behind Cuban Lady; still early days and she could have a big role to play back on turf.

runners.comment: Placed in both of her runs and latest was at Wolverhampton in April; respected
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on her Southwell debut (6f, AW) in November and she built on that with a creditable third behind an odds-on rival at Wolverhampton in April; that form puts her firmly in the picture and she's open to more progress; respected.

runners.comment: Has lots to find on the figures and handicaps look the way forward after this
runners.spotlight: Finished out the back behind Jettie's Run at Kempton in October and was down the field again on her Southwell reappearance (6f, AW) in April; has lots to find now switched to turf and handicaps will be more suitable.

runners.comment: Showed promise when upped to 6f at Yarmouth and she's open to more progress; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Finished fifth in her two runs this spring but she was only beaten around 3l at Yarmouth (6f, good to firm) last month and that was a major step forward from her debut; this well-bred filly should continue to improve with experience and she's in the mix with Oisin Murphy booked.

runners.comment: Got detached after a slow start and was always in rear on C&D debut (80-1) last Monday
runners.spotlight: Got detached after a slow start and was always in rear on her debut over C&D (80-1) last Monday; can only be watched.

runners.comment: Signs of ability on Kempton debut last month but has lots to find on this switch to turf
runners.spotlight: Showed signs of ability at a massive price on her Kempton debut (7f, AW) last month but was 8l adrift of the winner in that race and she has lots to find on this switch to turf; passed over.

runners.comment: Tailed-off last at a massive price on her Wolverhampton debut (8.6f, AW) 11 days ago
runners.spotlight: Always behind and was a tailed-off last at a massive price on her Wolverhampton debut (8.6f, AW) 11 days ago.

runners.comment: The only runner who lacks experience but she needs checking in market
runners.spotlight: Third foal; dam 5.7f 2yo winner (RPR 70), half-sister to 7f/1m winner Golden Wedding and 1m4f winner Percy Willis; the only runner who lacks experience but she needs checking in market.

races.race_name: Fitzdares Sprint Series Handicap (Windsor Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Good third in Class 2 at Newmarket latest and he's respected on this drop back in grade
runners.spotlight: Quite a progressive sprinter on turf/AW, winning three times; suffered bad luck at Newcastle on Good Friday, then ran creditably to finish third at Newmarket (6f, good) last month; on same mark on this drop back in grade and he's respected.

runners.comment: Won both his starts and latest was in a C&D novice last month; respected on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Won at Chelmsford in sole 2yo start and he made it 2-2 when defying a penalty over C&D (good to firm) on his return last month; that was a narrow success but he held off the favourite and is open to more progress on this handicap debut; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Eyecatcher in big field at Ascot last month and has claims if he can build on that
runners.spotlight: Dead-heated in 6f Chelmsford maiden on his seasonal return (gelded after 2yo campaign); hasn't threatened in two handicaps since but he made some late headway in big field at Ascot last month and was beaten less than 3l; has possibilities if he can build on that and his win came under Rob Hornby.

runners.comment: Three 7f wins but he ran a big race over 6f on his penultimate run; dangerous back in trip
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been at 7f but he was a good second over this trip at Newcastle on AW finals day; didn't pack the same punch when fifth at Ascot (7f, good to firm) last time but he's still unexposed as a sprinter and is not ruled out back in trip.

runners.comment: Unbeaten after two starts and he's an interesting contender now switched to a handicap
runners.spotlight: Cost 150,000gns last May and arrives here unbeaten after wins in maiden at Ayr (5f, good) last summer and novice at Pontefract (6f, good; made all) in April; looks on fair mark now switched to a handicap and he could have a lot more to offer; interesting contender.

runners.comment: Unexposed gelding but he's not gone on since his win and has bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Won Down Royal maiden (5f, good) last September on the second of his three 2yo run for Jack Davison; may have needed the run on handicap/stable debut at Sandown in April but he's not gone on since his win and has bit to prove back up in trip.

runners.comment: Lightly raced but he's found things tough in two handicaps this spring; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Won a Newbury novice (6f, good to firm) for the Coles last summer but he's found things tough since including in two handicaps for new yard this spring; still lightly raced and mark is sliding but others are preferred.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Doncaster but he now goes back up in grade and needs to find more
runners.spotlight: Won a Bath maiden (5.7f, firm) last June; some solid efforts in handicaps since, including at Doncaster (4l second) last month, but he now goes back up in grade and needs to find more to get back on the scoresheet.

runners.comment: Two novice wins on AW but he's come up short in four handicaps; down the list
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-3 when completing a Wolverhampton double (6f, AW) in November but he's come up short in four handicaps this year; mark is falling but he was beaten 8l at Newmarket last time and his turf form lags some way below his best AW efforts; down the list.

runners.comment: Overall record of 1-10 and well held in three runs for new yard this spring
runners.spotlight: Ran in a couple of Group 3s for Stuart Williams late last summer before changing hands for 40,000gns; returned to handicaps for new yard this spring but he's been well held in his three runs and overall record now stands at 1-10; opposable.

races.race_name: Fitzdares Telephone Betting Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Disappointing at Newbury (hurdles/Flat) in last two runs and has bit to prove
runners.spotlight: 5yo who is versatile ground-wise; triple turf winner who scored at Newbury (1m2f) in October but he's been disappointing there (hurdles/Flat) in his last two runs; now drops back in grade but has bit to prove and he's still 5lb higher than for last win.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner who won at Lingfield latest and is a big player again up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Made it 4-16 on turf when battling well to score at Lingfield (1m2f, good to firm) last month; up 3lb but he was as good as ever last time and two of his wins have come over C&D; big player again back at this track.

runners.comment: Reappeared with a close call over C&D in April and he's respected up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Six-time turf winner who returned after seven months off with a strong-finishing second over C&D (good to firm) in April; up 3lb but he remains well handicapped on his best form and he's an interesting contender with Oisin Murphy booked.

runners.comment: Course winner who had a near-miss off reduced mark at Kempton latest; respected
runners.spotlight: Narrowly denied a now smart stablemate in a Windsor novice (1m, good to firm) last June; hasn't really gone on from that in handicaps since but he had a near-miss off a reduced mark at Kempton (1m3f) last month; dictated a steady pace in that five-runner race but he could get any easy lead again and he's only 1lb higher on this return to turf; respected.

runners.comment: Won on AW latest but 4lb rise make things tougher and his last turf run was 12 months ago
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner but his last six wins have been on AW and latest was at Lingfield (1m2f) in April; hard to rule out another good effort but a 4lb rise makes things tougher and his last turf run was 12 months ago.

races.race_name: Get Raceday Ready Handicap

runners.comment: C&D win off 1lb higher last September; yet to shine in two runs in 2025 but can't dismiss
runners.spotlight: C&D win off 1lb higher last September; only fifth in her two runs this year but she's capable at this level if back to her best.

runners.comment: 1m4f AW win last summer; lacklustre reappearance but should fare better today
runners.spotlight: Her win came on AW but she has run to a similar level on turf; lacklustre seasonal return at Bath six weeks ago but could prove a different proposition with that run behind her.

runners.comment: Bath win (11.6f, good to firm) on return in April; similar form latest; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner, the latest on his seasonal reappearance at Bath (extended 1m3f, good to firm) in April; second over the same C&D 19 days ago; each-way shout again.

runners.comment: Won this race last year off the same mark; the return of blinkers looks a plus; key player
runners.spotlight: Not found his best in two runs this year but there are positives today, namely a win in the corresponding event 12 months ago off today's mark (enhanced a good course record on fast ground) and the return of blinkers; high on the list.

runners.comment: Unplaced in eight turf runs but is effective on it; placed over 2m on AW latest; chance
runners.spotlight: Two-time AW winner; unplaced in all eight turf starts but he is effective on it; creditable third at Lingfield (2m, AW) when last seen five weeks ago; not ruled out.

runners.comment: AW win in April and two solid efforts have followed; best turf run came here; contender
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at the 17th attempt when winning a 1m4f handicap at Wolverhampton in April; just missed out at Southwell one week later and better than the bare result back at Southwell 33 days ago; only turf effort of note came at Windsor so don't rule out a big run.

runners.comment: Yet to make a splash in handicaps; easy enough to swerve after 235 days off
runners.spotlight: Won a small-field AW novice (1m) in November 2023, her second start; she has started at 22-1 or bigger for each of her eight handicap runs and hasn't made much of an impact; opposable after 235 days off.

runners.comment: Bath win last spring off 4lb higher; back from a break and likely best watched
runners.spotlight: Won at Bath last spring off a 4lb higher mark (similar trip, good ground); retained ability on AW over the winter and although his latest run wasn't his best, it was over a trip that looked to stretch him; absent for 135 days and likely best watched.

runners.comment: 12-race maiden for whom the new trip/headgear needs to have a galvanising effect
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden; ran well over 1m here on his stable debut last May but backward steps ever since; hopes pinned on the new, longer trip and the addition of blinkers (has worn a visor and cheekpieces in the past) sparking a revival.

runners.comment: Out of sorts over hurdles this winter and fared no better back on the Flat last month
runners.spotlight: Not in much form over hurdles this winter and a return to the Flat didn't make any difference when a remote ninth at Salisbury four weeks ago (1m6f, good to firm); too much to prove.

runners.comment: Seven-time AW winner but yet to show much in six turf starts
runners.spotlight: Seven-time AW winner but he hasn't finished within 15l of the winner in six turf starts; hard to recommend.

races.race_name: Fitzdares Handicap

runners.comment: Added to his four AW wins when scoring over C&D nine days ago; big player again up 2lb
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 31211232131 since last July and his last success was over C&D (good) nine days ago; that was his first win on turf but he's only 2lb higher today and is a major player again.

runners.comment: Last win was in August 2023 and he's been well held on Tapeta and turf last twice
runners.spotlight: Six-time turf winner but his last success was in August 2023; returned to form with a close call at Wolverhampton (8.6f, AW) in October but diminishing returns since and was only fourth of five on his Bath reappearance (1m, firm) last month; others preferred.

runners.comment: Inconsistent 10-race maiden and she needs to find more back at this trip; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: 0-7 for Peter Chapple-Hyam and 0-3 this year for current yard; on dangerous mark and was runner-up at Wolverhampton (9.4f, AW) in March but she didn't match that back on turf at Wetherby (1m2f, good to firm) last time; tongue-tie is now added and she needs to find more back at this trip.

runners.comment: Two turf wins last July and latest was over C&D; needs a close look back in this sphere
runners.spotlight: Two turf wins on fast ground last July and latest was over C&D; down the field on her Kempton reappearance in April but that was a Class 4 and she may have needed the run; now drops back in grade and she needs a close look on this return to turf.

runners.comment: Has been up and down in handicaps and was quiet on reappearance in April; down the list
runners.spotlight: Won a three-runner Pontefract maiden (1m, soft) last May, but mixed bag since going handicapping; ended last season with a good third off 2lb higher at Newcastle but he reappeared with a laboured effort at Chelmsford in April (first run since gelded); may have needed that run but he's now 1-9 and others are more solid.

runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo and he needs watching in market on stable/seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden but he had a near-miss in a Newcastle handicap (1m) on his penultimate run last season; left George Boughey for 14,000gns in the autumn; returns after 230 days off but he still has potential and needs watching in market on stable debut.

runners.comment: Five-time turf winner but he's been out of sorts this spring; needs big turnaround
runners.spotlight: Five turf wins, the most recent at Bath (1m, good) last September; now 2lb lower than for that success but he's a frequent slow starter and has been out of sorts in two runs this season; has something to prove and he needs a big turnaround.

races.race_name: Today's Gate Sponsored By The INPBA Fillies Maiden

runners.comment: Rated 80, shaped like 1m would suit here on latest, drawn wide but should go well
runners.spotlight: Rated 80 after four starts; Starspangledbanner filly ran a nice race on seasonal return here over 9.5f (good); drop back to 1m will suit on the evidence of that effort; should go well.

runners.comment: Rated 80, closely matched with Chocalho, improve for return, up in trip a plus, chance
runners.spotlight: Rated 80 after three starts; runner up twice at Dundalk last year (closely matched with Chocalho on second run); should improve for comeback in a 7f Curragh handicap and will appreciate the extra furlong here; wide draw not ideal but obvious chance on form.

runners.comment: Rated 75, highly tried after debut, went close in 7f maiden here in April, place chance
runners.spotlight: Rated 75 after seven starts; highly tried to no avail after debut third behind Lake Victoria; touched off back in a maiden here (7f, soft) on seasonal return in April; carried head awkwardly when beaten 6.5l upped to 1m at Leopardstown latest (good); place claims but needs more to win.

runners.comment: Promise both runs last year including here, 1m should suit, yard in form, chance; blinkers
runners.spotlight: Rated 77; best effort in two starts last year came second time out at Dundalk (closely matched with Dancing Teapot); promise on debut here over 7f (good); dam won an Argentinian Group 1 so should appreciate this trip and her yard is in flying form; considered in first-time blinkers.

runners.comment: 66-1 and well beaten on debut, new yard had big priced winner last week, best watched
runners.spotlight: Cracksman filly was 66-1 and never landed a blow on debut for Matthew Smith last July; best watched after absence on debut for new yard (had a big priced winner at Down Royal last week).

runners.comment: Ghaiyyath filly, 33-1 and just minor promise here on debut, drops in trip, more needed
runners.spotlight: One of three for yard; Ghaiyyath filly sent off at 33-1 for debut here over 9.5f and just showed a glimmer of promise; drops back in trip; needs a fair bit more to be competitive in this company.

runners.comment: 22-1 and beaten 23l on debut, half-sister to Snellen so could do better, check market
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; 22-1 and beaten 23l on debut at the Curragh last September; Blue Point filly is a half-sister to the yard's very useful filly Snellen so should do better at some stage; worth a market check.

runners.comment: Debut C&D run not totally devoid of promise, more needed to be competitive here
